definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The carpenter working on the rafter passed his axe down to his mate below.
sentences.chinese: 在椽子上幹活的木匠將斧子傳給下面的夥伴。

sentences.english: The rafters, spaced at approximately 80cm centers, are nailed to the purlin.
sentences.chinese: 椽子釘在連繫樑上，中心間距爲80釐米。

sentences.english: Most of these houses still have their original rafters.
sentences.chinese: 這些房子的大部分仍然保留著原先的椽子。

sentences.english: The rafters that jut out rot first.
No structural alterations required, easily fits between joists and rafters.
sentences.chinese: 沒有結構改動需要，很容易適應的託梁和椽子。

sentences.english: The job got frustrating once I started working up high, building the fourth wall and roof rafters.
sentences.chinese: 在高空安裝第四面牆和屋頂椽子的工作更令人沮喪。

definition: a building/the frame of a building/roof beam/truss
beam/rafter/lintel/person able to bear heavy responsibility/mainstay (of organization)/pillar (of state)
floor/floor (ie. metal plate, concrete slab, wooden planking etc)
